name: Introduction to Information Retrieval
description: C.D. Manning, P. Raghavan, H. Schütze. Cambridge UP, 2008. (First book for getting started with Information Retrieval).

name: Search Engines: Information Retrieval in Practice
description: Bruce Croft, Don Metzler, and Trevor Strohman. 2009. (Great book for readers interested in knowing how Search Engines work. The book is very detailed).

name: Modern Information Retrieval
description: R. Baeza-Yates, B. Ribeiro-Neto. Addison-Wesley, 1999.

name: Information Retrieval in Practice
description: B. Croft, D. Metzler, T. Strohman. Pearson Education, 2009.

name: Mining the Web: Analysis of Hypertext and Semi Structured Data
description: S. Chakrabarti. Morgan Kaufmann, 2002.

name: Language Modeling for Information Retrieval
description: W.B. Croft, J. Lafferty. Springer, 2003. (Handles Language Modeling aspect of Information Retrieval. It also extensively details probabilistic perspective in this domain, which is interesting).

name: Information Retrieval: A Survey
description: Ed Greengrass, 2000. (Comprehensive survey of Conventional Information Retrieval, before Deep Learning era).

name: Introduction to  Modern Information Retrieval
description: G.G. Chowdhury. Neal-Schuman, 2003. (Intended for students of library and information studies).

name: Text Information Retrieval Systems
description: C.T. Meadow, B.R. Boyce, D.H. Kraft, C.L.  Barry. Academic Press, 2007 (library/information science  perspective).

name: INF384H / CS395T / INF350E: Concepts of Information Retrieval (and Web Search)
description: Matthew Lease (University of Texas at Austin).

name: CS 276 / LING 286: Information Retrieval and Web Search
description: Chris Manning and Pandu Nayak (Stanford University).

name: CS 371R: Information Retrieval and Web Search
description: Raymond J. Mooney (University of Texas at Austin).

name: CS 172: Introduction to Information Retrieval
description: Vagelis Hristidis (University of California - Riverside).

name: SIMS 240: Principles of Information Retrieval
description: Ray R. Larson (UC berkeley).

name: 11-442 / 11-642: Search Engines
description: Jamie Callan (CMU).

name: 600.466: Information Retrieval and Web Agents
description: David Yarowsky (John Hopkins University).

name: CS 435: Information Retrieval, Discovery, and Delivery
description: Andrea LaPaugh (Princeton University).

name: Information Retrieval and Data Mining
description: Dr. Jilles Vreeken , Prof. Dr. Gerhard Weikum (MPI).

name: COMP6714 Information Retrieval and Web Search
description: Prof. Wei Wang (University of New South Wales).

name: Coursera
description: Text Retrieval and Search Engines -  Prof. ChengXiang Zhai (University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign).

name: Apache Lucene
description: Open Source Search Engine that can be used to test Information Retrieval Algorithm. Twitter uses this core for its real-time search.

name: The Lemur Project
description: The Lemur Project develops search engines, browser toolbars, text analysis tools, and data resources that support research and development of information retrieval and text mining software.

name: Indri Search Engine
description: Another Open Source Search Engine competitor of Apache Lucene.

name: Lemur Toolkit
description: Open Source Toolkit for research in Language Modeling, filtering and categorization.

name: DBPedia
description: Linked data web.

name: Cranfield Collections
description: This is one of the first collections in IR domain, however the dataset is too small for any statistical significance analysis, but is nevertheless suitable for pilot runs.

name: TREC Collections
description: TREC is the benchmark dataset used by most IR and Web search algorithms. It has several tracks, each of which consists of dataset to test for a specific task. The tracks along with suggested use-case are:

name: Blog
description: Explore information seeking behavior in the blogosphere.

name: Chemical IR
description: Address challenges in building large chemical testbeds for chemical IR.

name: Clinical Decision Support
description: Investigate techniques to link medical cases to information relevant for patient care.

name: Confusion
description: Study Known Item Searching problem.

name: Contextual Suggestion
description: Investigate search techniques for complex information needs (context and user interests based).

name: Crowdsourcing
description: Explore crowdsourcing methods for performing and evaluating search.

name: Enterprise
description: Study search over the organization data.

name: Entity
description: Perform entity-related search (find entities and their properties) on Web data.

name: Filtering
description: Binarily decide retrieval of new incoming documents given a stable information need.

name: Federated Web Search
description: Study merge performance for results from various search services.

name: Genomics
description: Study retrieval efficiency of genomics data and corresponding documentation.

name: HARD
description: Obtain High Accuracy Retrieval from Documents by leveraging searcher's context.

name: Interactive Track
description: Study user interaction with text retrieval systems.

name: Knowledge base acceleration
description: Study algorithms that improve efficiency of human Knowledge Base.

name: Legal Track
description: Study retrieval systems that have high recall for legal documents use case.

name: Medical Track
description: Explore unstructured search performance over patients record data.

name: Microblog Track
description: Examine satisfaction of real-time information need for microblogging sites.

name: Million Query Track
description: Explore ad-hoc retrieval over large set of queries.

name: Novelty Track
description: Investigate systems' abilities to locate new (non-redundant) information.

name: Question Answering Track
description: Test systems that scale beyond document retrieval, to retrieve answers to factoid, list and definition type questions.

name: Relevance Feedback Track
description: For deep evaluation of relevance feedback processes.

name: Robust Track
description: Study individual topic's effectiveness.

name: Session Track
description: Develop methods for measuring multiple-query sessions where information needs drift.

name: SPAM Track
description: Benchmark spam filtering approaches.

name: Tasks Track
description: Test if systems can induce possible tasks, users might be trying to accomplish for the query.

name: Temporal Summarization Track
description: Develop systems that allow users to efficiently monitor the information associated with an event over time.

name: Terabyte Track
description: Test scalability of IR systems to large scale collection.

name: Web Track
description: Explore information seeking behaviors common in general web search.

name: GOV2 Test Collection
description: This is one of the largest Web collection of documents obtained from crawl of government websites by Charlie Clarke and Ian Soboroff, using NIST hardware and network, then formatted by Nick Craswel.

name: NTCIR Test Collection
description: This is collection of wide variety of dataset ranging from Ad-hoc collection, Chinese IR collection, mobile clickthrough collections to medical collections. The focus of this collection is mostly on east asian languages and cross language information retrieval.

name: CLIR Test Collections
description: This dataset can be used for cross lingual IR between CJKE (Chinese-Japanese-Korean-English) languages. It is suitable for the following tasks:

name: Cross Language Q&A (CLQA) dataset collection
description: It supports following bi-lingua and mono-lingua:

name: Advanced Cross Linugal Information Retrieval and Question Answering (ACLIA)
description: The dataset is used for the task of cross-lingual question answering but the complexity of the task is higher than CLQA dataset.

name: Conference and Labs of the Evaluation Forum (CLEF) dataset
description: It contains a multi-lingual document collection. The test suite includes:

name: Reuters Corpora
description: The corpora is now available through NIST. The corpora includes following:

name: 20 Newsgroup dataset
description: This data set consists of 20000 newsgroup messages.posts taken from 20 newsgroup topics.

name: English Gigaword Fifth Edition
description: This data set is a comprehensive archive of English newswire text data including headlines, datelines and articles.

name: Document Understanding Conference (DUC) datasets
description: Past newswire/paper datasets (DUC 2001 - DUC 2007) are available upon request.

name: Extreme Classification: A New Paradigm for Ranking & Recommendation
description: Manik Verma (Microsoft Research)

name: The next web
description: Tim Berners-Lee (Ted Talk) [Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web. He leads the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C), overseeing the Web's standards and development].

name: Is Pivot a turning point for web exploration?
description: Gary Flake, Technical Fellow at Microsoft (TED Talks).

name: Challenges in Building Large-Scale Information Retrieval Systems
description: Jeff Dean (WSDM Conference, 2009).

name: Knowledge-based Information Retrieval with Wikipedia
description: David Wilne (The University of Waikato, 2008).

name: Music Information Retrieval Using Locality Sensitive Hashing
description: Steve Tjoa (RackSpace Developers) [This talk shows that IR is not just text and images].

name: The Functional Web -- The Future of Apps and the Web
description: Liron Shapira (Box Tech Talk).

name: Information Experience
description: Solution to Information Overload on Web - Doug Imbruce (Techcrunch Disrupt)[Doug Imbruce is the Founder of Qwiki, Inc, a technology startup in New York, NY, acquired by Yahoo! in 2013].

name: Internet Privacy
description: Dr. Alma Whitten (Google Brussels Tech Talk).

name: The moral bias behind your search results
description: Andreas Ekström (Swedish Author & Journalist, TED Talk).

name: Beware online "filter bubbles"
description: Eli Pariser (Author of the Filter Bubble, TED Talk).

name: Think your email's private? Think again
description: Andy Yen (CERN, TED Talk) [This talk talks about privacy, which Search Engines intrude into, and how can people protect it].

name: Do we have the right to be forgotten?
description: Michael Douglas [TEDx SouthBank].

name: The case for anonymity online
description: Christopher "moot" Poole" (Ted Talks) [Christopher "moot" Poole is founder of 4chan, an online imageboard whose anonymous denizens have spawned the web's most bewildering and influential subculture].

name: Web Search and Data Mining Conference
description: WSDM.

name: Special Interests Group on Information Retrieval
description: SIGIR.

name: Text REtrieval Conference
description: TREC.

name: European Conference on Information Retrieval
description: ECIR.

name: World Wide Web Conference
description: WWW.

name: Conference on Information and Knowledge Management
description: CIKM.

name: Forum for Information Retrieval Evaluation
description: FIRE.

name: Conference and Labs of the Evaluation Forum
description: CLEF.

name: NII Testsbeds and Community for Information access Research
description: NTCIR.

name: Information Retrieval and the Web
description: Google Research.

name: IR Thoughts
description: Dr. Edel Garcia.

name: Deep Neural Network Learns to Judge Books by Their Covers
description: Information Extraction.

name: Can Deep Learning help solve Deep Learning
description: Information Retrieval from Lip Reading.

name: To reduce biases in machine learning start with openly discussing the problem
description: Bias in Relevance.

name: Whoa, Google’s AI Is Really Good at Pictionary
description: Sketch-based search.

name: Neural Network Learns to Identify Criminals by Their Faces
description: Information Extraction.
